definition: acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: The Patriots totally misconstrued this passage and ignored its context.
sentences.chinese: 完全曲解这段经文并忽略其上下文。

sentences.english: But Hawks and others say the news media misinterpreted the findings.
sentences.chinese: 但霍克和其他人说，新闻媒体曲解了调查结果。

sentences.english: Incorrect interpretation of conclusions drawn from laboratory studies have unnecessarily alarmed some people.
sentences.chinese: 对实验室研究结论的曲解导致了某些人不必要的恐慌。

sentences.english: He contorted the document out of its proper meaning.
sentences.chinese: 他曲解了文件的正确含义。

sentences.english: I am sorry if you have misunderstood my message by subjective interpretation.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉地说，您主观臆断，曲解了我文章的原意。

sentences.english: A wise believer understands the essence of Buddhism. Those who are superstitious misinterprets the virtue of religion.
sentences.chinese: 智信者深体佛法之精神，迷信者曲解宗教的美意。

sentences.english: Misunderstanding (MIS) and deliberate misinterpretation (DMI) are two notions that are easy to be mixed up.
sentences.chinese: 误解和刻意曲解是两个易被混淆的概念。

sentences.english: Our commitment and dedication to people should never be misconstrued as paternalism.
sentences.chinese: 我们对员工的宗旨和努力不应曲解为家长作风。

sentences.english: Thus dispensationalists have misconstrued God's work of salvation and (again) the newness ofthe New Covenant.
sentences.chinese: 因此，时代论者曲解了神的救赎工作和新约的新义。

sentences.english: Australian Govt. was the first Govt. which misinterpreted from its satellite images.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚政府是第一个曲解卫星图像的。

sentences.english: I have heard some malevolent misrepresentation of her.
sentences.chinese: 我听到一些来意曲解她的话。

sentences.english: A wise believer understands the essence of Buddhism, Those who are superstitious misinterpret the virtue of religion.
sentences.chinese: 智信者深体佛法之精神，迷信者曲解宗教之美意。

sentences.english: People who don't like this approach mistakenly suggest it is undisciplined.
sentences.chinese: 不喜欢这种方法的人会把它曲解为不守纪律。

sentences.english: You are misrepresenting my view on this matter.
sentences.chinese: 你在曲解我对此事的意见。

sentences.english: This is truly a perversion of the open source spirit.
sentences.chinese: 这完全是对开源精神的曲解。

sentences.english: Most telling, the purpose of the pavilion in the garden was misunderstood as a place for frivolous pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数的叙述中，亭台的作用被曲解为玩乐的地方。

definition: to belittle/to disparage/to play down/to demean/to degrade/to devalue
to defame/to libel/to defile/to smear/to vilify
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
to make a fool out of/to fool/to dupe
